result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G Shultis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond of $150 applied to court costs with balance due during probation term. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael G Shultis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael G Shultis in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of no contest entered. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael G Shultis in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Weil requests 7/13/2016 court date to discuss additional item with State. Bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michael G Shultis in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Weil requests plea/sentencing date. Bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on June 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Due to a calendar conflict, time rescheduled from 1:15 pm to 2:00 pm on 6/6/2016. Notice mailed.
Further proceedings on June 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michael G Shultis in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel enters a not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
conditions:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No violent contact with victim.

Defendant Michael G Shultis appears by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Jamie McClendon.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests $300 cash bail with conditions. Counsel states defendant thought this was a ticket and didn't need to appear at hearing. Counsel has received copy of compaint and waives reading. Defendant qualifies for public defender. Court sets bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
Defendant Michael G Shultis not in court. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause and orders arrest warrant issued.
